availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James E. Thompson (Mercer Co, Ky, farmer)

body.p: Mercer County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of George Thompson and Lucy Thompson. Married Mary J. Campbell Thompson in Trimble County, Kentucky, on October 11, 1848. Father of Lucy Thompson. Farmer in Mercer County in 1850. Owned thirty-two slaves in Mercer County in 1850. Farmer in Mercer County in 1860. Owned fifteen slaves in Mercer County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, District 1, p. 249B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, Harrodsburg, p. 752.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Trimble County Marriages, Film 000420389, p.370.
Find A Grave, "James E. Thompson (January 22, 1821-August 16, 1891)," Memorial #45613018, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/45613018 (accessed December 27, 2020).
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, District 1, p. 837.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer, p. 56.
